definition: lit. to pull sb into the water/to involve sb in a messy business/to get sb into trouble
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to use (sb) as a tool
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to say a matter has no relationship with the individual referred to, to emphasise one is innocent or in the clear
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to play tricks on/to make a fool of
variant of 趟渾水|趟浑水[tang1 hun2 shui3]
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: not to get involved/to stay out of it
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to make a false countercharge
see 連鍋端|连锅端 [lian2 guo1 duan1]
to weigh down/to trouble/to implicate (sb)/tied down (by affairs)
